summary: This is a declaration by Assistant U.S. Attorney A. (name redacted) filed in support of the United States' response to a victim's emergency petition. It details the federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, victim notification procedures, the 2007 non-prosecution agreement, and interactions with victims and their attorneys.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the federal and state investigations for using facilities of interstate commerce to induce minors into prostitution. The declaration discusses the 2007 agreement to defer federal prosecution in favor of state prosecution.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Attorney representing victims T.M., C.W., and S.R. He filed the emergency petition on behalf of 'Jane Doe' which prompted this declaration. The AUSA details communications with him regarding victim notifications.

persons.name: T.M.
persons.context: One of Bradley Edwards' clients, identified as a victim of Epstein while a minor. She was represented by James Eisenberg (paid by Epstein) and was described as 'openly hostile to the prosecution of Epstein' in 2007.

persons.name: C.W.
persons.context: One of Bradley Edwards' clients, identified as a victim of Epstein while a minor. She was notified of the 2007 agreement, secured pro bono counsel to avoid a deposition by Epstein's team, and was later represented by Edwards.

persons.name: S.R.
persons.context: One of Bradley Edwards' clients, identified as a victim of Epstein while a minor. She initially refused to speak with investigators in 2007 but was interviewed and confirmed as a victim in May 2008.

persons.name: James Eisenberg
persons.context: Attorney who represented victim T.M. His fees were paid by Jeffrey Epstein. The AUSA notes that all contact with T.M. was through Eisenberg due to this representation.

persons.name: David F. Levi
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge for whom the declarant (AUSA A.) clerked after law school. This is part of the declarant's professional background.

events.title: Federal Investigation Initiated
events.description: The FBI initiated an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein at the request of the Palm Beach Police Department for using interstate facilities to induce minors into prostitution.

keyFacts: The federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein began in 2006 based on a request from the Palm Beach Police Department, focusing on the use of interstate facilities to induce minors into prostitution.

A non-prosecution agreement was reached between Epstein and the U.S. Attorney's Office in September 2007, deferring federal prosecution to the State of Florida while preserving victims' rights to sue under federal law (18 U.S.C. ยง 2255).
Victim T.M. was represented by attorney James Eisenberg, whose fees were paid by Jeffrey Epstein, the target of the investigation, creating a potential conflict of interest.

The AUSA states that victim T.M. was 'openly hostile to the prosecution of Epstein' in 2007 and, due to her prior statements, could not in good faith be included as a victim in a potential federal indictment.

The declaration reveals that victims were not consulted prior to the 2007 non-prosecution agreement, and Epstein's attorneys complained when victims were notified, fearing it would incentivize them to overstate claims for damages.
